bow: what do you feed your kids for breakfast find breakfast to be the hardest meal to feed my kids somewhat healthy meal regardless of it being healthy or not what do your kids usually eat monday to friday we usually all have boiled eggs my two year old has one with half slice of toast and butter milk or some of smoothie if we had time to make one to shake it up we might put jam or peanut butter on the toast or buy different kind of bread sometimes we mash the egg with greek yogurt and dill weed or just slice it up weekends tend to be the time for something different pancakes french toast scrambled eggs etc am very pregnant whatever she can get for herself cereal toast fruit yogurt she is we have scrambled eggs lot and all of our breakfasts include fruit usually bananas strawberries or blueberries otherwise ll make big batch of pancakes on sunday and put them in the fridge so they can have pancakes for few days other favorites are yogurt cereal toast with jam or avocado or just plain donuts on special days mini muffins she usually wakes between 7:30 and is too hungry right away so usually just banana and milk then at about when she hungry usually make her turkey bacon hashbrown and fruit or little breakfast burrito totally get that you need your rest just got laid off am enjoying being able to sleep in bit have and year old we are in the fend for yourself mode they love it lol give my almost year old oatmeal with fruit lot since it seems to be her favorite on my lazy days she gets cereal if feeling up to really cooking ll make blueberry pancakes with eggs but most mornings it combination of oatmeal and fruit for sure she has banana when she first wakes up then before nap time make her blueberry oatmeal cover the bottom of the bowl with frozen blueberries put layer of oats on that tiny amount of water microwave for minute 1tsp of sugar and some milk and done easy and healthy cream of wheat is really popular here make it with half milk half water and when it done cooking add giant glob of peanut butter in two adult servings last me three or four days usually given with banana and maybe breakfast sausage removed 36 weeks strong working family here year old and year old on weekdays the older one usually wants bit of granola with extra dried cranberries the younger prefers some plain greek yogurt with some jam swirled in sometimes they just want banana we are all out the door by and they get snacks in the am as well at preschool and daycare on weekends it toasted english muffins with peanut butter and jam oatmeal with raisins and cinnamon and or one of the above we do breakfast for dinner lot or for weekend lunch so that when we do scrambled eggs or pancakes or whatever that more elaborate fruit bannanas berries apple orange or the occasional kiwi toast or bagel with coconut oil nutritional yeast or peanut butter oatmeal with almond slivers and raisins craisins on weekends waffles or pancakes with veggie sausages tofu scramble or chickpea scramble mine only eats toast fruit and oatcakes she very fussy buttered toast and some fruit most recently scrambled eggs and avocado is also popular oatmeal with chia seeds blueberries and maple syrup is favourite he dried prunes dried mango slices then either cheerios with banana or oatmeal with raisins milk he allergic to eggs make the oatmeal in big batches so it fast in his lunch put protein vegetable grain my kid is hungry right when he wakes up so do overnight oats with frozen berries our fruits in the morning just take it out of the fridge and microwave for 40 seconds to warm up little monday and friday cheerios and fruit smoothie tuesday and thursday oatmeal wednesday either eggs and sausage or peant butter toast with banana and typically smoothie saturday pancakes waffles sunday one of the above well feel like bad parent mine eats cereal for breakfast usually dry because he does like milk and not healthy cereal fruit loops with marshmallows cinnamon life rice crispies with nesquick cocoa powder on the weekends we do eggs and rice sometimes my year old usually has nutrigrain bar at our house while we get ready to leave then he has cereal oatmeal and fruit when he gets to daycare he not big breakfast kid even when we re home on the weekends my son just turned since about months breakfast is veggies cut up small and sautéed then an egg scrambled in add bit of salsa and let it cool piece of toast with some no salt no sugar pb and small bit of no sugar added jam try to do as many veggies at breakfast as can in case the rest of the day falls apart my year old usually has cereal raisin bran crunch or frosted mini wheats to be specific more sugar than like but 🤷‍♀️ 4yo twins here they start hungry and get mean if they dont have food pretty quickly gets whole milk greek yogurt pouch about oz the other gets an applesauce pouch first thing then either pancake make whole batch of the kodiak cake pancakes over the weekend then freeze them round in the toaster takes them back to life waffle nutrigrain bar and sometimes piece of bacon as they walk out the door for school to be fair school will feed them breakfast but they are so picky feel better having put something into them that know is at least somewhat nutritionally viable we usually do fruit and either cereal with almond milk or we make pancake muffins or donuts pancakes in baked donut pan which our 5yo loves hand food is hit find overnight oats to be easy my daughter loves it and can make couple of days worth at once quick oats yogurt fruit almond butter milk and cinnamon are my usual ingredients stick it in the fridge the night before then give it to her first thing otherwise it whole wheat peanut butter toast yogurt or cheerios with milk you got ta feed them what they ll eat full belly is better than nothing good job mama toast cereal they enjoy flavored oatmeal when it cold out although it summertime right now so letting them rot their teeth but once school starts again it the healthy stuff for sure scrambled egg in tortilla is hit and courtesy of my neighbor one beaten egg with vanilla and cinnamon will be fully absorbed by one piece of whole wheat bread so can sneak an egg worth of protein into some relatively healthy french toast the only thing that mucks it up is the syrup fried eggs and either grits or oatmeal cereal only on saturday mornings wow suck at breakfast it ranges from cereal muffins to pop tarts to frozen sausage biscuits they cook on their own hah my 10 year old sometimes drinks coffee depending if we are up already they are early birds they get up with the sun should re evaluate my life choices just terrible in the mornings my husband works second shift and end up waiting up for him every night peanut butter on banana with few mini chocolate chips sometimes just pb on spoon sometimes chex mix in bag in the car it not always battle choose to fight my toddler usually has slice of toast with hummus spread on it sometimes make her baby oatmeal with banana if she eats all of her food give her handful of cheerios to pick at until she inevitably starts tossing them on the floor my baby is pretty young so we mostly stick with fruit and oatmeal and stuff like that for me and my husband like to make *eggs mixed with cheese and bell peppers baked in muffin tins *biscuits *blueberry oat crumble which is basically granola baked on top of fruit *sausage *chorizo mixed with salsa eggs peppers and cheese in tortillas *pancakes *banana oat protein bars which is mashed bananas mixed with oats peanut butter cinnamon and salt and baked *homemade irish soda bread which love because it pretty quick for bread and nice for weekends oranges bananas grapes blueberries strawberries raspberries blackberries and cherries we rotate based on the season and what on sale they usual get fruit first and if they finish it they can ask for something else that helps get them to eat the fruit plus the fruit will go bad where as the dry goods do usual options are oatmeal bagels cereal eggs pancakes or waffles milk is also served each morning sometimes they drink it sometimes they do usually fruit recently it been clementines yogurt dry cereal cheerios or apple jacks and sometimes those apple sauce pouches from costco mini pancakes waffles cinnamon toast bacon oatmeal cereal bagel toast with peanut butter eggs or fruit some combo of those rice krispies cheerios corn flakes with milk and maybe banana or some blueberries scrambled eggs with kraft singles slice melted into it just like at waffle house jiffy blueberry muffins instant oatmeal vanilla greek yogurt lara bars cold pizza this morning my year old wanted can of tuna and bowl of rice krispies mean literally whatever they will eat more than 100 billion bananas are eaten every year in the world making them the fourth most popular agricultural product *** ^^^i amp 32 amp 32 bot amp 32 *bleep* amp 32 *bloop* amp 32 amp 32 amp 20private 20message 20with 20the 20subject 20 27i 20hate 20potassium 27 20 amp 32 amp 32 **🍌** https np reddit com bananafactbot comments 8acmq6 banana st=jfof9k8d amp sh=acd80944 oats huge bag of quick oats for about add little water microwave for minute add ins are endless chia seeds cinnamon maple syrup jam nuts seeds fruit apple sauce honey my daughter has been eating them since she was about months still loves them even plain overnight oats are great too can prepare couple days worth at time again flavours are endless also make granola with the oats which are great with little milk or yogurt and fruit my year old prefers scrambled eggs he also likes grits or one of the not so sugary cereals rice crispies kix corn flakes he loves pancakes and waffles but do make them often because hubby does like them starting to realize that kid may be bit carb addicted so try to get those eggs in him every morning for good protein amen to this we do fruit and some kind of protein either cottage cheese or yogurt or eggs or pb toast very easy if we do eggs try to put some veggies in there but my kids are picky af right now and usually just pick around find dinner to be the hardest for me it because my kids eat big breakfast decent lunch and then think they re not really that hungry for dinner even though feel like they should be eating but with that being said fresh fruit with hemp seeds is big hit for us oatmeal with hemp seeds for kick of protein and omegas cinnamon raisins maple syrup and splash of milk sometimes eggs and toast more so for the year old my year old is into eggs what do you usually make for dinner oatmeal sometimes cereal soup rice or just rice if they re cranky eggs alot of ketchup or maybe should say ketchup eggs lol give them whatever fruit we have but my son usually doesn eat it just plays then pack of yogurt im mostly fighting my son 2yr that he cant have milk until he eats some real food banana and greek yogurt with granola almost every single day she ll also usually have some cereal or bamba or something pre breakfast as snack weekends are often the same but sometimes scrambled eggs or waffle with peanut butter or bagel with cream cheese 21 months frozen waffle usually frozen pancakes with fruit typically oranges and peaches no syrup pancakes are usually blueberry flavored sometimes cheese stick is added if she extra hungry year old husband does morning duty while leave early for work buy frozen waffles cinnamon bread yogurt and sometimes cereal for the kids one likes oatmeal in winter that and some fruit is breakfast husband has coffee and have oatmeal or yogurt at work oh goodness dinner is my favorite always trying to come up with new ideas today was orange and rosemary pork chops with loaded mashed potatoes steamed broccoli and some mac cheese for the kids it was yummy my favorite go to meals are spaghetti goulash baked chicken with roasted potatoes and green vegi green beans brussel sprouts broccoli chicken and rice cilantro lime chicken tacos and quesadillas also almost always have the ingredients for my favorite salad power greens mix or just spinach strawberries red onion feta cheese fresh cracked pepper and then evoo and balsamic as the dressing the kids don always love the food but their only option is what mommy made for dinner also try to batch cook and meal prep on sunday to ensure we have lunches and dinners either made prepped or planned out for the week today also made an asian salad dish and it turned out super yummy ll make lunches for me out of that for the whole week in order of my preference oatmeal instant oatmeal whole wheat toast healthy cereal junk cereal my kid is allergic to eggs by 6th grade was forcing my child to take slice of toast running out the door until realized that the dog was finding and eating said toast every night on her evening walk probably bad mom though we have junk food breakfast poptart yogurt or toaster pancake if get lucky she ll eat apple slices she used to do cereal but now refuses she used to do eggs but refuses terrible yes but it gets the job done for kid who really only wants to eat one meal day lunch dinner is also struggle but we do better there she three my almost loves graham crackers and milk fruit bars with applesauce or yogurt or cereal those are the usual options he downed bananas year or so ago when it cools down we ll have more oatmeal especially because ll be nursing new baby in january my year old hates breakfast he will not wake up and feed himself so when go downstairs ask him what he wants we have short amount of time in the morning to get ready so it has to be quick he refuses most cereals and oatmeal occasionally he will eat pop tarts or some frozen waffles have no idea what to feed him tbh my year old will wake up and feed herself breakfast usually she will make herself bagel toast frozen waffle bowl of cereal or yogurt it not particularly healthy cereal but pick my battles and breakfast isn one of them weekends are easier but my son still is not breakfast person idk often leftovers we leave the house by seven year old has banana or oatmeal to go pouch or egg cup of was organised on sunday 90 of the time this is consumed in the carseat on the drive in hence portability lol 1tsp of sugar added to the natural sugar in fruit sounds delicious but maybe not so healthy not being cow btw just saying mine are school aged every day it carb pancakes waffles or toast with scrambled eggs fruit and milk or oatmeal with fruit and milk ve always been big breakfast eater so like to make sure they get good start in the morning the older two are on adderall so they do always eat much lunch and really need the calories well figure she doesnt eat most of the milk and doesnt eat like half of the oatmeal so shes probably getting less than half of that teaspoon of sugar its not that sweet not like its candy and the healthy nutrients are still there whether the sugar is there or not people are sugar nazis lately yeah sorry really wasn trying to be cow it not per say the 1tsp that you gave her that bad but the accumulation of sugar from all the various foods per day which adds up and gives me shills am admittedly low key sugar nazi yeah thats basically all the sugar she gets during the day dont consider it lot stay home and cook everything from scratch so know everything that goes into our food some fruit and little sugar for breakfast is not going to kill anyone agreed
